legacy.name: Graham Allison

legacy.full_text: China’s withdrawal of its pandas from the Washington National Zoo is a textbook case of “dumb” power. In an age where people talk about hard power, soft power, sharp power, we need at least one more bucket: dumb power.

It should be made clear: It's not China "withdrawing the pandas". 

It's the US hesitating to renew the leases.

The cost of upkeep is steep, and to make things worse, some politicians/scholars are framing 🐼 to depict an 'evil/dumb' China, fueling a call for US retaliation. https://t.co/kkRq1FCwFk

value.string_value: Commission head Ursula von der Leyen and other senior officials have hit out at what they say is Beijing’s disruptive influence and unfair trade policies.
‘Explicit element of rivalry’: EU warns of harsher stance on China before summit

legacy.description: The South China Morning Post brings you news and analysis about Hong Kong, China and the rest of Asia. Get our app: https://t.co/f15xfjosWQ
legacy.name: South China Morning Post

result.text:
This is absolutely unbelievable 🤦‍♂️ Ursula Von der Leyen, who according to the EU's constitution has NO BUSINESS doing foreign policy, now blames China for the "escalation" in Gaza:
https://t.co/i7ApH6Rq4p

Here's what she said: "China states that it is impartial and favours peaceful solutions, while enabling and supporting some of the world’s most destabilising forces. And yet, China and Europe have a shared interest in stability in the Middle East. So every measure of influence that Beijing has on Hamas and on Iran needs to be used to prevent further escalation."

This is gaslighting to the extreme given that China, alongside virtually the entire global South, is vehemently advocating for a ceasefire and a political solution whilst Von Der Leyen has been cheerleading Israel every step of the way in their destruction of Gaza. 

So who is actually "enabling and supporting some of the world’s most destabilising forces" and not "using their influence to prevent further escalation" here? 🤔

This woman IS a destabilizing force. For the Nth time she is the worst possible representative of Europe at this moment in time and is a weapon of mass destruction of Europe's image and standing in the world. Europe just cannot afford to let her continue suiciding the continent.

legacy.full_text:
Western media have been filled with alarming reports accusing China of forcibly enrolling one million Tibetan children into boarding schools.      

But what is the reality? We embarked on an investigative journey to uncover the truth. #Tibet #xizang 
https://t.co/oqZpWQdr8F

This video is literally breathtaking.   

At 4,800 meters, where the oxygen level is thin, every step we took left us breathless.

The Western world may imagine #Tibet differently, but the lies of Western media can never withstand the scrutiny of on-site, firsthand reporting.

legacy.full_text:
"Global markets are now flooded with cheaper Chinese electric cars. 

And their price is kept artificially low by huge state subsidies.

We are launching an anti-subsidy investigation into electric vehicles coming from China."

— President @vonderleyen #SOTEU 2023 https://t.co/1xSiv3VzmM

EU's probe is protectionist and political.

China's top EV export to Europe is now Tesla from Shanghai. The US gives Tesla a $7,500 subsidy per car, but the EU is silent. 

China's EV subsidies are fading, yet their exports to Europe, even at double the price, compete well.

legacy.full_text: The path of Chinese modernization is characterized by fairness and equity, while the US achieved its modernization through the means of plunder and exploitation. @tri_continental #China #US #Modernization https://t.co/79Q1XomvuG

The point about Chinese investment in the Global South isn't because they're being nice. 

China also seeks profit, but what sets apart China's approach to modernization from that of the US is that China strives for a fair agreement, while the US exploits.

legacy.full_text:
In '99, the Philippines beached a ship on Ren'ai Reef in the SCS to assert a claim over the disputed area.

The incoming President Estrada vowed to have the ship towed away.

In '03, Estrada's successor Arroyo reaffirmed the commitment.

But 24 years have passed, the ship remains https://t.co/h1M84XVoBK

Western media likes to show China as the one causing trouble in the South China Sea, but they don't really talk about how China has been trying to keep things peaceful by having lots of talks with neighboring countries.

legacy.description: @ChinaDaily Tweets my own. #MediaUnlocked El pueblo unido jamás será vencido. #大白话讲新闻
legacy.name: Xu Pan

legacy.full_text:
During calmer times, Philippine leaders pledged to remove the ship, preserving good business ties with China.

In the 2000s, China and ASEAN aimed to settle disputes via talks. Philippines pledged to follow rules and resolve ship issue peacefully. https://t.co/StvSOC3Cb9

legacy.description: @ChinaDaily Tweets my own. #MediaUnlocked El pueblo unido jamás será vencido. #大白话讲新闻
legacy.name: Xu Pan

legacy.full_text:
But with changing governments and US involvement, the ship became the Philippines’ leverage in China-US competition.

They started resupplying the ship with steel and cement, consistently documenting their voyages with media and cameras to highlight China's "aggressive" behavior. https://t.co/VdqPqI1hua
